title: Tesla's Price War Could Hit Its Profits
text: Tesla will report earnings after the market closes Wednesday. The car maker's decision to slash prices is expected to hit its profit.

title: Tesla cuts prices for Model 3, Model Y on eve of Q1 earnings
text: Tesla has cut the price of its Model 3 and Model Y electric vehicles for the second time this month. Now, Tesla's most popular models will start under $40,000 before incentives.

title: Caution! 3 Stocks That May Run Out of Steam in 2023
text: The stock market has been off to a hot start so far in 2023. All four major U.S. stock indices are higher so far on the year, while the Nasdaq's 15.75% return is more than double the next-best performer (the S&P 500).

title: 3 Reasons the Sleepy Action in Stocks is Set to End
text: The Fed meeting, earnings season, and jobless claims are all due by end of the week. Stocks are also trading in an extremely tight range - a sign they may be ready to explode in one direction or another.

title: The 7 Most Innovative Stocks to Invest in Today
text: 2022 was a forgettable year for financial markets. That also included several of the most popular innovative stocks.

title: Analysis: China's Xpeng takes cues from Tesla for its new EV platform
text: Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng Inc is the latest manufacturer hoping to save money and speed development and production by shifting to a digital vehicle architecture - an approach that bears a striking resemblance to Tesla Inc's.

title: Price Cuts & High Deliveries to Fuel Tesla (TSLA) Q1 Earnings
text: The recent price cuts are likely to have resulted in a Q1 delivery beat for Tesla (TSLA), which bodes well for its upcoming quarterly release.

title: Tesla Stock Hit With Bear Notes Before Earnings
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA)Â reports first-quarter earnings after the close on Thursday, April 19.

title: What Lies Ahead for Tesla ETFs in Q1 Earnings?
text: Tesla stock has risen about 52% so far this year, outperforming the Zacks industry average growth of 14.2%. The solid trend is likely to continue, given that Tesla has a reasonable chance of beating estimates this quarter.

title: China EV Price War Reaches Fever Pitch: An Analysis
text: With various automakers like F, XPEV, NIO, BYDDY and others joining the Tesla-fueled EV price war in China, it's the potential EV buyers who are making the most out of the cut-throat competition.

title: Tesla Teases Manufacturing Process That Could Cut Costs Drastically For New $25,000 BEV
text: Tesla Teases Manufacturing Process That Could Cut Costs Drastically For New $25,000 BEV

title: Sorry, Tesla Fans! Ford Is Now the EV Tax Credits King.
text: Most news out of the electric vehicle (EV) sector this month has centered around the new tax credits. Some EVs will qualify for $7,500 in tax credits as part of the Inflation Reduction Act, enacted last year by President Joe Biden's administration.

title: Inflation figures take centre stage on Wednesday, plus Tesla results
text: UK inflation figures delivered a shock rebound last month when most were expecting it to fall and the Bank of England, for one, will be hoping there is no repeat this time. The consumer price index bounced to 10.4% in February from 10.1% in January, when the market had been looking for a fall to 9.9%.

title: A New EV Manufacturing Giant in the Making -- Which Stocks Will Win?
text: Foxconn's push to become an EV manufacturing leader creates opportunities for semiconductor stocks.

title: Top 3 S&P 500 biggest gainers in Q1 2023
text: US stocks bottomed in the last part of 2022 and staged a remarkable comeback despite the Federal Reserve's ongoing tightening. During the first quarter of 2023, the S&P 500 index gained 7.5%, but some companies truly outperformed.

title: NIO Won't Cut Prices Like Tesla Did. The Stock Is Down.
text: CEO William Li believes his company's products and services are good enough to maintain their prices while Tesla puts pressure on the industry.

title: Tesla Earnings: Why Guidance Is Key
text: Earlier this year, Tesla said demand for its vehicles far exceeded its production levels. Investors will look for a more timely update on vehicle demand when the company reports earnings this week.

title: Elon Musk Lays Out His AI Plans. Tesla Investors Should Be Worried.
text: Musk spoke about his AI ambitions in an interview with Fox News Channel's 'Tucker Carlson Tonight,' suggesting another politically controversial move for the Tesla CEO.
